meanings.definition: The small, round, red or orange fruit of a rose plant, typically used to make tea or jam.
meanings.sent1: I picked some fresh rosehips from the garden to brew a fragrant tea.
meanings.sent2: Grandma made delicious rosehip jam from the ripe fruits she gathered.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to juggle the delicate rosehips but ended up with a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the sweet scent of rosehips, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant color of the rosehips brightened up the dull kitchen counter.

meanings.definition: The fruit of a rose plant, containing high levels of vitamin C.
meanings.sent1: Eating rosehips regularly can boost your immune system due to their vitamin C content.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended including rosehips in her diet to increase vitamin C intake.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the rosehips were tiny superhero capes, each with its own power.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as refreshing as a sip of rosehip-infused water on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The burst of tangy flavor from the rosehips awakened her taste buds.

meanings.definition: The edible fruit of a rose plant, often used in herbal remedies.
meanings.sent1: Rosehips are a common ingredient in natural herbal remedies for colds and flu.
meanings.sent2: The herbalist prepared a healing potion using dried rosehips and other herbs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the dried rosehips around the room, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as soothing as a cup of warm rosehip tea on a chilly evening.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of rosehips filled the room, calming everyone with its herbal scent.
